meanings.definition: To move quickly back and forth or up and down
meanings.sent1: The dog shakes its tail happily.
meanings.sent2: She shakes the snow off her coat before entering the house.
meanings.sent3: The earthquake shakes the ground, making everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: His laughter shakes the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The dancer shakes with energy and rhythm on stage.

meanings.sent1: The old man's hands have uncontrollable shakes.
meanings.sent2: She felt the shakes in her legs after the intense workout.
meanings.sent3: The cold weather gives me the shakes every morning.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake caused the building to have shakes.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of the race gave her the shakes before it started.

meanings.definition: A milkshake or similar beverage made by shaking ingredients together
meanings.sent1: I love to have chocolate shakes in the summer.
meanings.sent2: The diner serves the best shakes in town.
meanings.sent3: The strawberry shake was so thick, it was like a dessert.
meanings.sent4: The vanilla shake was a cool treat on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: She ordered a large shake with extra whipped cream.

meanings.definition: A sudden and brief spell of an illness or feeling
meanings.sent1: He had a few shakes of dizziness before sitting down.
meanings.sent2: After the scare, she felt the shakes of fear in her body.
meanings.sent3: The shakes of excitement before the concert were overwhelming.
meanings.sent4: The shakes of nerves made her hands tremble.
meanings.sent5: The shakes of anticipation kept her on edge.

meanings.definition: A gesture of agreement or understanding, typically involving a handshake
meanings.sent1: They sealed the deal with a firm shake.
meanings.sent2: The shake of hands signified the start of their partnership.
meanings.sent3: The business meeting ended with a friendly shake.
meanings.sent4: His confident shake showed he was ready for the challenge.
meanings.sent5: The shake of hands was a symbol of mutual respect.
